Fields.DialogueText: My goodness, what do you think you're doing!?
Ah, Capitano, apologies. I'm just completing my daily sword and spear training.
Afternoon, Giorgio. What have you got--
HIYA!
Do all Belles wield such primitive weapons?
Not particularly. Most Belles prefer heavy artillery in my experience. But in my opinion, nothing beats an honorable duel! That's where REAL fighting skill gets tested.
I see. Well, just be careful. You nearly took my head off!
Will do, Capitano! Whether a Morgana picks a fight from afar or wants to get up close and personal, you can rely on me to protect you!
And the crew, right?
Huh? Oh, right! Certamente! The crew's lives are just as essential to keeping us afloat... Ecco-- are those Morganas?
I can't see any--
Those are definitely Morganas, Capitano. Trust me, my Belle vision is more refined than yours. We should forget what we were talking about and deal with them quickly!
I wanted to talk a little more about--
No time, Capitano! Let me show you the efforts of my training! HIYA, HIYA, HIYA!
@BATTLE
Phew! I worked up a sweat in that duel!

Fields.MenuText: Do you believe all's fair in love and war?
What's your dueling weapon of choice?
Do you think you could beat me in a duel?

Fields.DialogueText: By no means, Capitano! There are laws about how to fight these things! Love, on the other hand...
I'm aware that in a bygone age, gentlemen would often settle disputes with "pistols at dawn." Yet being quick on the draw feels more anticlimactic than an extended clashing of blades!
It depends on the challenge, Capitano! You might best me in a naval history Olympiad, but I'm sure you couldn't keep up with me in a fig eating contest!
Fighting with honor is one of the last few refuges we have for engaging in such needless bloodshed. St. George had no need for tricks when he slew the dragon. I'd like to emulate that.
In that case, I would be honored to join you sometime in a light sparring session.
Certo? That's great! I have some extra weapons I seldom use stored in the engine room. Are you more of a mace or nunchaku kind of person?
Maybe we'd best stick to something like chess instead...
Giorgio? Are you down here? I'm here for our sparring session.
Sono qui! I'm just cleaning my weaponry.
Good Lord! Look at all of these tools. You're like a one-Belle army!
These aren't all battle-ready. Some of them I received as gifts from the Italian royal family as well.

Fields.MenuText: Why polish something that will be stained with blood?

Fields.DialogueText: You make a good point. Although, like my armor, I enjoy keeping things spotless. I guess it's similar to wearing makeup - not to impress a man but to make yourself feel beautiful.

Fields.MenuText: Which would you recommend for me?

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm... Maybe something small like a switchblade would work for melee. As for a sidearm, my bias is leaning towards the new Italian Beretta pistol. It has a little kick, but I'm sure you can handle it!

Fields.MenuText: Would you ever settle a dispute with fists instead?

Fields.DialogueText: There is no excuse for hitting a girl, Capitano! Firing explosive rounds at them, however, is a different story.
*ALARM*
I've been itching to try some of these out! Grab whatever takes your fancy, Capitano, and meet me upstairs!
These Morganas won't know what hit them!
And by the look of some of these doodads, I won't know what's hitting them either!
@BATTLE
Have you found something suitable for me yet?
I know it's down here somewhere... Why don't we come back in a little while and check again if you can't handle the heat?
I'll have you know I can handle plenty of heat. Just as long as we turn it up slowly...
I keep underestimating how hot it is down here in the belly of the beast.
You've been down here before, haven't you, Capitano?
I have, but stay down here long enough and it takes a toll all the same. I tell you what, if a dragon's fire is half the heat of this room I'd take a fleet of Morganas any day!
*ALARM*
I think you just said the magic words, Capitano. Who knew Morganas had to be invited in just like Dracula! They truly are an evil bunch!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Do you think dragons deserve the hate they get?
Would you rescue a dragon in need of saving?
Why are dragons of legend always evil?

Fields.DialogueText: I think you're being too literal, Capitano. The dragons could be metaphors for famine, disease, or invading forces. They are an evil of the time that have to be defeated, much like our Morganas.
You're frazzling my mind, Capitano! I think you just instigated a war between two halves of my soul! I might leave that choice up to you in such a case.
For burning down villages, eating children, and committing mass murder? I'm not sure about you, Capitano, but I'm still on the fence...
Ah! Here it is! A genuine stiletto knife. Let's go up to the deck and test it out!
*WALKING*
*GNGNGN*
Did you remember to leave the door ajar, Giorgio? You know we need a key to open it from the inside.
Of course I did! I'm only a klutz in the physical world. My mental faculties are as polished as my armor! Let me have a try.
*GNGNGN*
At least I think I did...
The crew are probably all out to lunch now. Nobody will be down here for at least another hour.
D... did you say... an hour? We're s-stuck in this s-sauna... FOR AN HOUR?!
*GNGNGN*
*GNGNGN*
*GNGNGN*
Are you up for a question about dragons?
Sempre!
IS ANYBODY OUT THERE?! PLEASE, HELP US!
Save your breath, Giorgio. They're all digging into whatever the main dish is tonight. The last thing they're concerned about is the engine room being somewhat louder than usual.
C-Capitano... I... you know I...
Come sit with me. Screaming your lungs out is going to give you heat stroke even faster. Try and keep a cool head.
Belles can't... sì, Capitano. As you wish.
Why are you getting undressed!?
You told me to keep cool! It's just my outer layer. I'm not THAT indecent!
There we go. Come sit beside me. Isn't that better?
Sì, Capitano. I'm feeling more relaxed already.
Really? Because your vice-like arms around my crushing ribcage tell a different story.
Sorry, Capitano! It looks like I'm still not over my fear of confined spaces.

Fields.MenuText: Have you tried closing your eyes?

Fields.DialogueText: And be trapped inside my head with my own circling thoughts about being trapped in reality!? No thank you!

Fields.MenuText: Is there anything I can do to help?
Could you fight a Morgana while trapped like this?

Fields.DialogueText: Just... stay by my side. Is that okay?
I'm not sure. I like to think my natural Morgana-fighting instincts would kick in and I'd forget that I was trapped.
*ALARM*
There's not much we can do about those Morganas from down here. Good thing you trained with the crew every day regarding what to do in our absence.
The battle might make them notice we've been missing. Or, the panic might have them forget about us entirely.
Looks like only time will tell.
@BATTLE
I don't know if we're going to survive this, Giorgio. It could be the end of the road for us.
What are you going to do if we make it out of this alive, Capitano?
A bloody steak and a glass of wine. I've taken food for granted so much in my life and I swear I'll never do it again. How about you?
I just want to tell San Marco I love her one more time. Then I can be at peace.
Any regrets you'd like to share in your final moments, Giorgio?
I try not to live with regrets... but, if we're spilling the our metaphorical beans, I may have just one.
Hit me.
Capitano... this may be the heatstroke talking but...
Giorgio? Why are you looking at me so intensely?
You don't know! You weren't there!
I've always wanted to tell you that... that... THAT--
*KNOCK*
Capitano? Giorgio? Are you in there?
*CREEAAK*
Giorgio! We're saved!
You haven't seen what we've seen! Been through what we've been through! You could never understand!
Capitano! Thank goodness, I'm so-- oh... I was going to hug you, but perhaps a shower is in order first. We're both dripping with sweat.
You guys were only down here for an hour, right? Was it really that bad?
*ALARM*
I think a nice Morgana bashing is just what I need to blow off some LITERAL steam!
I couldn't have put it better myself, Capitano! Let's do this!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know Belles could sweat.
How hot is Italy normally?
Do you prefer summer or winter?

Fields.DialogueText: Morganas are child's play compared to this. I haven't worked up this much of a sweat in weeks.
It barely tops 30 degrees Celsius even in summer. Plus, it's not humid like it is down here, so it's very palatable.
I'm not partial to either if I'm being honest. A cool autumn breeze is all the relief I need.
@BATTLE
Giorgio, walk me through something.
Capitano?
We've got to talk about something else. Take our minds off the sweltering environment.
When we went off to battle just now, you were quite enthusiastic.
Sì, Capitano! I set off straight through...
... That bulkhead. Like a ghost.
Er... heh, so it would seem. Imagine that.
Once I'm done with this after action report, you and I are going to have a long talk about Belle abilities.
A long talk... Well, why not? I'd love nothing more than... er... Certo, Capitano.

Fields.MenuText: I'm going to have a steak.
Shower. Definitely.
I'm going to have these locks looked at.

Fields.DialogueText: How about you?
Capitano... are you sure about this?
I think so. As long as you are. Why don't you take hold of it?
It's so big I can barely hold it. Like this?
Yes, that's good. Let me help you as well.
Wow, you really know your stuff, Capitano!
I've had a lot of practice. Now, hurry up with it.
Shouting isn't going to get me there any faster, Capitano.
There it is. Now, for the payment of your services. How much do I owe you?
For controlling the scout plane? No charge. Consider it a free trial.
This controller deck is so big, Capitano. Weight isn't a problem, but I can barely hold it without your help.
This is one of the best scout planes on the market. Are you interested?
Seems like Giorgio's made the decision for me.
This scout plane and controller deck don't come with a matching wheelbarrow, do they? How is anyone supposed to carry this!?
Pleasure doing business with you.
I'm surprised, Capitano. It seems your naval knowledge extends into all outreaches of war. I may have underestimated you.

Fields.MenuText: You don't expect a naval officer to know about war?
How empty-headed did you think I was!?

Fields.DialogueText: I've found that, usually, those who enlist in the Navy do so out of a passion for the sea. However, you are quite knowledgeable on all things warfare as well. You never cease to surprise me, Capitano!
That came out wrong! I meant that... though I may have pondered at times your knowledge of land and aerial combat, I NOW believe you to be competent. There, much better!
*ALARM*
Let me prove to you just how smart your Capitano is, Giorgio! Morganas ho!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Would Saint George underestimate a dragon?

Fields.DialogueText: Not if he wanted to escape with his armor unsinged! I take your point, Capitano.
How goes the training, Giorgio? Think you could defend Libya in your current state?
Capitano...
Giorgio? Are you all right? You look a bit flushed.
I'm fine... I'm just seeing red because of those Morganas. Would you help me dispatch them?
@BATTLE
How are you feeling now, Giorgio?
I've been training day in, day out recently. I've barely had time to sleep...

Fields.MenuText: Must you train so relentlessly?
You haven't taken any breaks?
Is Libya worth destroying your body over?

Fields.DialogueText: The two are synonymous, Capitano. The essence of Libya is coursing through my veins as we speak. If Libya falls, my body does too. And if my body falls defending it, Libya will fall soon after.
I tried to have a nap sometime last week, but I woke up twirling a spear about my fingertips. I think I was sleep-training...
I told you already, Capitano, I dislike regret. I must give myself the best possible chance in my quest. If I lose when I could have done more to prepare, it will eat at me throughout my afterlife.
That being said, I do feel a little dizzy... Maybe just one more workout and I'll...
Giorgio! Don't worry, I've got you!
Capitano...
You're burning up! Let's get you inside quickly.
Capitano... I'm... I'm...
Don't speak, Giorgio. You need to save your strength.
Mi dispiace. I'm... sorry...
Is there anything more I can do for you, Giorgio?
You've already done so much, Capitano. The cold compress, allowing me to stay in your quarters; I couldn't want for anything more in the world.
I'm glad to to hear it. In that case shall we--
If I had to make one teeny tiny suggestion? I would love some more figs. Although, I understand if I'm being too much of a burden.
I'll get you some figs, don't worry.
Are you sure? I wouldn't want you to feel obligated to dote on me.
No, no. This is a decision I've made entirely by myself and one that I came to on my--
Well, as long as you're sure!
At least let me finish!
*ALARM*
What do you say, Giorgio? Are you fit enough to get back out there?
It's like riding a bike, Capitano!
@BATTLE
Grazie again, Capitano. It is terribly shameful to be seen this way...

Fields.MenuText: Hey, you nursed me back to health before. It's the least I can do.
Shameful? In what way?
I didn't know Belles could get sick.

Fields.DialogueText: That was different, Capitano! It is my duty to defend you in all walks of life, whether it be by your bedside or on the battlefield. If I were to falter...
It is my life's purpose to defend that which I hold dear. Being reduced to such a state, in which I can barely stand, is positively pitiful...
It isn't inherently akin to what you experience under a heavy fever. It's more so a sign of fatigue. It seems my stamina is still heavily lacking...
Don't talk like that, Giorgio!
Capitano?
You've carried us through so many battles, smiling all the while. Why is it so damning for you to have a break once every millennium!?
I don't have time to rest... The path I walk is one of turmoil, Capitano.
That doesn't mean you have to walk it alone!
I'm sorry for raising my voice, Giorgio. I didn't mean to make you cry.
No, Capitano. Worry not - these aren't tears of sorrow.
Is your fever flaring up again? Let me feel your forehead... No, it seems to be fine.
That's strange... This is the hottest I've felt this whole day... Grazie, Capitano. For everything.
Afternoon, Giorgio. You're looking much healthier now.
It's all thanks to Nurse Capitano! I've taken your advice to heart and allowed myself several rest days in order to recharge. Would you care to join me?
What do we have here?
You should know them all, Capitano. Some of the great treasures of Italy: pasta, pizza, the list goes on.
I see. So, your bulking phase is well underway?
Are you calling me fat?
*ALARM*
That question is far scarier than any Morgana I've ever seen. BATTLE STATIONS, PEOPLE!
@BATTLE
You've done so much traveling, Giorgio but you don't strike me as much of a food connoisseur.
I suppose you're right. Although Italy is renowned for its cuisine, I think of food as nothing more than fuel. I simply eat enough to keep myself chugging along. Aside from figs, of course...

Fields.MenuText: Would you consider yourself patriotic?

Fields.DialogueText: Certamenta! Just because I dislike sports or music that other Italians enjoy does not mean I cannot appreciate other things the country has to offer.

Fields.MenuText: Which country has the overall best cuisine?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not that invested into flavor or spices, so perhaps British food would suffice. It is easily made and fairly bland, but contains just enough calories to power a good training session!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you could cook for me sometime.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, are you sure about that? I'd hate to repeat the coffee incident with something like a flaming hot lasagne!
So if you don't enjoy the food or sports, what parts of Italy do you like?
The landscape is beautiful to behold, Capitano. Moonlit gondola rides along the Venice canals or hiking up Mount Etna, just to name a few. I'd love to show you one day, Capitano!
I never knew you were such a romantic, Giorgio.
I-I didn't mean it like... I think it's time you left me to my meal, Capitano. Any more bother and I might gobble you up instead!
Okay, Giorgio, I'm ready for our sparring session! Come at me in whatever way you like.
As you wish, Capitano! It would be an insult to your character for me to hold back. HIYA!
What power! I feel sorry for any Morgana that gives you the stink-eye.
Grazie, Capitano. Be sure to keep your shoulder up. Otherwise, I can disarm you fairly easily.
Got it!
(Even amidst such intensity, Giorgio can still smile and offer me advice. She truly is incredible...)
Had enough, Capitano?
Don't count me out just yet!
(She always bites her lower lip when attempting a finisher. That's my chance to strike!)
This is the end, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: (There it is!)

Fields.DialogueText: It's my win!
I'm afraid not.
Whuh? Uwah!
*GLOMP*
Owowow... You knew I was trying to read your movements?
It's a classic strategy in combat, Capitano. Bait a tell and then exploit it.
Looks like I still have a long road to walk before I can catch up to you.
Just remember, Capitano, as you told me before: you don't have to walk it alone.
*ALARM*
At least I KNOW that the Morganas will never give me trouble! Care to join me, Giorgio?
I don't know, Capitano. Perhaps you'd like to try and take them down solo. You know, as part of your training.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: She's fast! Too fast!
(Here goes nothing...!)

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano! I brought you some tea before you head to--
HIYA!
KYA!
*SMACK*
Ow! Giorgio, what was that for?!
You startled me, Capitano! What on earth are you doing?
Well... I was getting sick of losing to you so... I...
You were training by yourself? Capitano, I'm so proud of you! Although, I am a little annoyed you didn't ask for my help.

Fields.MenuText: I can't very well ask the Morganas for tips on how to beat them, can I?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose not. But the benefit of having your opponent be your companion means you get access to that juicy intel.

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to surprise you with my improvement...

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think my heart can handle this new breed of adorable Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: You train this hard every day? I can hardly breathe!

Fields.DialogueText: You've probably been waving that thing about without the proper technique!
Come here, Capitano, and let me show you how it's done.
Whu-wha-- you're wrapping your arms around me?!
Relax your shoulders. I told you that before; listen to me next time! Control your breathing and stagger it as you move.
I'll try.
Now lift your arm like this. I'll pull on your waist to keep you from losing balance.
How's that?
Bene, Capitano. You're a natural.
I find it ironic that, when teaching how to act violently, your teaching style is the most relaxed!
It is strange. When teaching, all I want is to get hands-on and show my student what needs to be done. You can't really do that with something abstract like language, unfortunately.
Giorgio? Everything all right?
Q-q-q-quite all right, Capitano, I'm afraid I got wrapped up in the moment.
I suppose that's why this is so easy. After all, right now my hands are all over... KYA!
Work on what I taught you and I'll be back to check on you later!
Wait, Giorgio! What about the lesson?
That's all for today's class! Read Chapter Three!
*SLAM*
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Okay, Capitano. Before you can wield a weapon, it's important to first be in tune with your mind.
It makes sense. Throughout history, most - if not all - of the most successful warriors have been thought to be geniuses of their respective crafts.
I'd like to take you on a guided meditation. I think it'll help you relax and get out of your head long enough to face me again.
(It's true that I couldn't stop overthinking Giorgio's next move during our sparring session. Maybe this will help alleviate some of the pressure.)
È pronto, Capitano? I want you to close your eyes and imagine yourself somewhere peaceful. In your own time, could you tell me where you are?

Fields.MenuText: I'm walking through a meadow.
I'm relaxing on the beach.
I'm on a luxury cruise.

Fields.DialogueText: You can smell the exotic fragrance of a thousand wildflowers dancing across the air currents.
Feel the sand between your toes and the waves lap against the shore.
Listen to the pleasant call of the seagulls above and the gentle rocking from the hull below.
Now, Capitano, I want you to imagine that I'm standing beside you.
I can see it. I can see you. Hi, Giorgio.
What do I look like?
You look like you always do. Smartly dressed, firm posture...
In your wildest fantasy, am I outfitted with a torpedo?
You weren't before but, now that you mention it, yes! Yes, you are! I can see the torpedo dangling from your side!
Molto bene, Capitano! You're doing such a good job! So, what you're saying is, you'd like a torpedo? Could you say that once more and, this time, speak very clearly.
I would like a... hang on a minute. What's that sound?
Nothing, Capitano! It's just the cool air of your happy place! Now, you were going to say--
Giorgio! Why are you holding the radio so close to my face!?
Ah! Capitano, you weren't meant to open your eyes yet!
Truth be told, we've had an offer for a torpedo. Funds are low at the moment, so I thought you'd be more inclined to accept if you were in a comfortable mood.
Give me that! You're very sneaky, you know that?
Apologies, Capitano... I really did think meditation would be helpful in aiding your progress. The radio call just aligned too perfectly.
We could probably afford a torpedo, but I'm putting my foot down. Next time, just ask me.
Understood, Capitano. Rest assured, it won't happen again.
*ALARM*
Morganas! Now, THAT is where my happy place truly lies!
Just how focused on your job are you!?
@BATTLE
*BZZZZZ*
Seeing as meditation was a bust, Capitano, I thought we'd try something different today.
What aspect of my mental faculties are we training this time?
Your reflexes! You could barely touch me in our last bout and I spied at least three instances where, had I wanted to, I could have ended your life.
*GULP* Three?
I'd like to try a call and response exercise. I'll say a word and you reply with the first thing that pops into your mind. No mulling anything over. Make it quick and snappy!
Got it.
Bene. "Fighting"!
War!
Good! How about... "Passion!"

Fields.MenuText: The sea!
My crew!
My ship!

Fields.DialogueText: Wonderful! As expected of a master sailor!
How selfless my Capitano is!
Without it, you'd be a marooned seaman stranded on a dinghy!
Finally, "happiness!"
Giorgio!
C-Capitano... What did you...
That's not what I meant! I just meant that I'm at my happiest when we're together! I mean, when you're by my side! I mean--!
Hahaha! It looks like the exercise was a success! If you can let go of any inhibitions during an actual fight, you may one day stand a chance against me.
*ALARM*
Ecco, Capitano. "MORGANAS"!
DEAD MEAT!
@BATTLE
I'd like to try one final trial to increase your combat prowess, Capitano.
It wasn't so long ago that we were nearly cooked like Christmas turkeys! Do you really want to train here?
I'll be okay, Capitano. I informed the crew to come and check on us in thirty minutes.
Okay then, Giorgio, what have you got for me?
I've got some ink blots here. There's no discernible right or wrong answer. I just want you to tell me what you see.

Fields.MenuText: Why do we need to be in the engine room for that?

Fields.DialogueText: It's the loudest place on the ship so I figured, if you could concentrate here surrounded by distractions, the quiet of the deck would make you unstoppable!
Okay, let me at it!
Capitano! What is this?
It's a rabbit! Easy!
Is it? But what if I hold it like this?
Wait... it's a duck?
Capisci, capitano? Things are not always as they appear. You fell for my tell in our first fight, but it could have just as easily been a double bluff.
I'm confused. First you tell me to get out of my head. Now you're telling me to be paranoid about everything.
It sounds confusing, but in a way, that's exactly what I'm saying. Get out of your head, but rely on the common sense and instinct coursing through your veins to take over.
*ALARM*
I think I get it. Let's see if I can test this theory out on some Morganas!
@BATTLE
Not to mention your ability to leave whenever you like, rather than be trapped all alone with me.
Er... Ovviamente no!

Fields.MenuText: I'd wondered where my stationery ran off to.

Fields.DialogueText: Silly Capitano! Stationery doesn't run.

Fields.MenuText: How do I know you're being objective with these questions?

Fields.DialogueText: Do you doubt your Belle, Capitano?
... Well, having asked a question, I'd say definitionally--
Are we plumbing the depths of your subconscious or not?
Remember everything I've taught you this far, Capitano.
I'll try to.
Stay out of your head and focus on the target in front of you, as opposed to a million possible future outcomes.
Got it.
I've dulled our weapons so we don't have to worry about injuring one another. The winner will be decided by whose behind hits the ground first.
Come at me whenever you're ready.
If you're sure, I won't hold back! KIYA!
*BOOF*
*BIFF*
*BOFF*
Capitano, your movement has improved drastically!

Fields.MenuText: Like I said, I've been itching to show you my improvement!

Fields.DialogueText: Sfortunatamente, I don't think you're quite there yet! You're wide open for a leg sweep! HIYA!
*DUN*
Ah! I'm not out--
Oh no you don't!
Hey! Giorgio, get off of me! Stop pinning my hands down!
Looks like it's my win again!
I guess what they say is true. All's fair in...
... War.
I think you're missing something out there, Capitano...
It's strange. I've felt like something has been missing in my life for a while now, but...
Maybe it was sat on top of me crushing my pelvis all along...
*ALARM*
C-Capitano... M-Morganas...
Right... Let's go... deal with some Morganas... or something...
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I don't feel any different...
Let's see you stop me now!

Fields.DialogueText: Could have fooled me... but you're still too slow! HYAH!
Your wish is my command! KAH!
Yesterday's training seemed to stray from our original purpose. So, today's session will be extra brutal to make up for lost time.
Just how brutal are we talking here?
Onestamente, it shouldn't be too strenuous. I just wanted you to be a little more prepared for when I turn up the heat.
I see. Well, that's a relief.
Okay, then let's begin! Just in case, the safety word is "Belle."
Wait, why do we need a safety--
*POW*
Giorgio! Have you been holding back your speed all this time!?
I had to give you a chance, Capitano. This, however, is my top speed... so try and keep up!

Fields.MenuText: Where did you learn to move so quickly?
I can barely keep an eye on you, let alone land a hit!
Heh, I've seen faster.

Fields.DialogueText: I've always been fast, Capitano! Why do you think I was forced to stop being a training ship? After a while, I grew bored and kept dodging the attacks. They could never hit me!
They say dueling is one of the hardest and loneliest sports in the world. You should be happy you're seeing double!
There's no way I can win...
I think... you may be right!
*SLAM*
Ah! Belle! Belle!
Hm? I don't see any Morganas, Capitano. I think you need your hearing checked if you're hearing alarm bells.
Not "bell;" "Belle!"
Oh, right! Mi dispiace, Capitano!
My arm... I think I might have dislocated it.
Capitano, I'm sorry. I got too carried away.
*ALARM*
Let me handle these Morganas. We'll retire to your quarters after.
@BATTLE
I know this for a lie because you're standing here to tell the tale!
Well, I don't know if it's broken or dislocated. Either way, I won't be able to move it for a while.
Capitano, ancora una volta, I would like to express my humblest of apologies.
It wasn't your fault, Giorgio. It was mine for underestimating my opponent. You were right - I haven't been taking this as seriously as I should have.
You needn't try so hard, Capitano. I'll always be there to protect you.
Then who will be there to protect you!?
Sorry for shouting, Giorgio. It's just... with you planning to head for Libya, I can't help but worry about your fate.
... Capisco. In that case, I must apologize anyway, Capitano. I had no idea your passionate training was over the backdrop of such determination.
How is your arm, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: Will you continue training me?

Fields.DialogueText: Rest assured, Capitano. A few broken bones won't get rid of me that easily!

Fields.MenuText: Do you think I can be as strong as you one day?

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, you're making me blush. Even the strongest human can't compare to a Belle... but you've got potential beyond the wildest dreams of most.

Fields.MenuText: How long do fractures normally take to heal?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, most fractures take about 6-8 weeks but, seeing as you aren't screaming in agony, it's likely just a sprain. It should heal in a day or two.
*ALARM*
Capitano, don't move a muscle! I'll deal with these interlopers and be right back!
@BATTLE
Okay, Capitano. Say "Ahh."
I'm not a child, Giorgio. Just because I'm incapacitated and you're forced to feed me doesn't mean you have to reduce my stature any more than it already has been.
Apologies, Capitano. Here is your strict and sensible spoonful of soup.
Thank you.
Good job! Who's my big, strong Capitano?
... I am.
Capitano, that reminds me. Speaking of lending an extra hand, we received a radio message asking if we were in need of additional crewmates.
Hmm...
With me caring for you at present, I can't tend to my other duties. I think it would be beneficial to bring on more people, but I thought I would check with you first.

Fields.MenuText: If we've got the training officers to handle them, by all means.
I'll be out of this cast in no time. We don't need any more men on this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll send a reply as soon as possible!
Understood, Capitano.
Come now, Capitano. You have to finish your soup to ensure a speedy recovery.
It's too hot. Can't I have a Cadbury Dairy Milk instead?
No, Capitano, you can't have chocolate just because you're injured.
Why not!?
Perhaps if I make eating the soup more enjoyable you'll be inclined to eat it. "Here's the San Giorgio liner, steaming in to ruthlessly slay some Morganas! CHOO CHOO! Listen to the alarm, Capitano--"
*ALARM*
Either you're a master ventriloquist, Giorgio, or--
Morganas! What timing! Finish your soup, Capitano. Leave the rest to me!
@BATTLE
Only good Capitanos who finish their soup are allowed chocolate for dessert!
You never let me have any fun...

Fields.MenuText: I'm not an invalid, Giorgio. You can attend to other things while I recover.

Fields.DialogueText: Out of the question, Capitano! I won't be responsible for your untimely demise!
How is your arm doing, Capitano? You seem to be able to eat by yourself now.
Much better, Giorgio! It's all thanks to your expert care.
Seeing as we can't compete physically against one another, I thought a game of wits would keep you sharp until you're ready for our next showdown.
What did you have in mind?
Have you heard of this game, Capitano? It came out in 1936, but it's exploded in popularity over the years.
Monopoly... haven't heard of it. How do you play?
Don't worry, Capitano. I'll teach you as we go!
Okay, set it up.
Monopoly is actually a very tactical game. You have to manage resources, control areas of the map, and bargain with anyone who'll listen.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds interesting.

Fields.DialogueText: Doesn't it? I'm sure your experience as a capitano will give you home-field advantage!
*ALARM*
First, let's take out these Morganas so we can play uninterrupted.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Sounds like you'd prefer a war game.
Can I get your assurance that you won't flip the board?

Fields.DialogueText: Let's start with economic warfare before we move on to the real deal.
I promise that our relationship will stand the test of traitorous dice!
Ha! Capitano, you've landed directly onto my most expensive property! Pay up!

Fields.MenuText: But I'm nearly broke and I have a whole crew to feed!

Fields.DialogueText: Take your sob story somewhere else, Capitano. I'm running a business here.

Fields.MenuText: Can I trade you a property instead?

Fields.DialogueText: Your properties are all mortgaged, Capitano! I'm afraid it's going to have to be cold, hard cash!

Fields.MenuText: What if I buy some figs in real life?

Fields.DialogueText: Although tempting, I'm offended that you think a businesswoman of my stature could be bribed so easily. You're lucky I don't report this offense.
Fine. Here.
Do you see where your mistake lies, Capitano?
Trusting you to explain the rules properly before buying up everything in sight?
In a way, you're right. The game is called "Monopoly" for a reason, Capitano. You spent your turns passing on properties and hoarding your cash, while I invested.
And where did that leave you? Forced to hand over all your hard-saved money to me when you land on my properties!
How exactly does this translate?
Don't be afraid to dive headfirst into something, even if it seems a little absurd. If you feel as though an opening arises where you could body slam your opponent, why not take it?
At least, should you miss, you'll learn that it maybe wasn't such a good idea.
*ALARM*
I'll tell you what I'd like to body slam right now! Let's Monopolize these waters!
@BATTLE
You're doing much better this time around, Capitano. We're fairly even with regards to money and properties.
We'll see. There's a dangerous corner coming up. Here goes nothing!
Eight! 1, 2 ,3, 4, 5, 6, 7, safe! Phew! Ok, your turn.
Anything but a three. Anything but a three. Anything but a... THREE!
NOOOOOO!
Oh dear, oh dear. What's happened here, Giorgio?
Capitano. Per favore, hear my case.
It looks like you've landed on one of my properties with maxed-out hotels. This is a pickle, isn't it?
Capitano... *cough cough* please, have a heart. I have medical expenses that need to be met.
Giorgio, Giorgio, Giorgio. You are a beloved member of my precious crew. I would never cast you out so easily.
Really?

Fields.MenuText: How about you trade the debt for a week of latrine duty?
I'm sure if you shined my shoes every day for the next two weeks, I could erase your debt.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitano, I never realized you were so cruel...
How degrading. Was my Capitano always this much of a sadist?
What's it going to be, Giorgio. Accept my ultimatum? Or accept defeat?
I think...
*ALARM*
I'll decide after this fight. Maybe these Morganas can inspire some fight within me.
Let's make sure these ships do not pass GO and do not collect $200!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure there are other ways you could work the debt off.

Fields.DialogueText: C-Capitano! To debase a knightess of my caliber would be...
Galley duty. What did you think I meant?
... Give me a minute more.
I think I'll have to admit defeat, Capitano. Ben fatto - and on your second try no less.
It was a good match, Giorgio, I had a lot of fun.
And with that, my final lesson is complete.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not following.

Fields.DialogueText: I know you're training for an admirable reason, Capitano. But until that fight comes, please don't forget to enjoy the time you have.
Giorgio...
Were I to be martyred in Libya, I don't want to think back to you training on the deck. I want to reminisce about these times we shared together.
I'm sorry, Giorgio. I--
Don't apologize, Capitano. You have nothing to apologize for. Just... try to smile more, OK? For me? You have such a nice smile.
You think so?
Not that I'm always looking or anything! It's just... I've been feeling...
Yeah... I've been... "feeling" too.
Regardless, the stage is set for our final sparring session. Shall we proceed up to the deck and get started?
*ALARM*
Perfect timing! Let's deal with the Morganas and get started!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Now, hold on. You're my Belle. You're not going anywhere.
The student has surpassed the teacher, wouldn't you say?

Fields.DialogueText: I hope never to, Capitano.
Beyond... beyond anything I could have predicted.
It has been an honor watching you grow as a fighter, Capitano. Now that I've taught you all that I can, there is only one avenue left for us to travel.
The feeling is mutual, Giorgio. You too have blossomed into a marvellously wonderful teacher. As long as the lesson is practical, you'd make a fine educator.
The rules are the same as they always are. Whoever puts the other onto the ground first wins.

Fields.MenuText: It will be my life's achievement to park your keister onto the deck.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd like to see you try, Capitano.
I have one request before we begin our duel.
Certo! Go ahead.
If I win, I want you to allow me to fight by your side in Libya.
Capitano, how can you expect me to accept such a request!? I plan to be martyred in Libya and you want me to sentence you to the same fate?
Regardless of what happens the day said battle occurs, I certainly do not want you to suffer through that fight alone.
Capitano... I'm still not--
If you've truly taught me everything you know, then where is the worry in having another Giorgio by your side?
Good point, Capitano. OK, if you can beat me, I will allow you to stay with me. Although I highly doubt that outcome will ever come to pass.
*ALARM*
Perfect! Let's dispatch these Morganas quickly so we won't have any distractions.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: If you want a defeat that badly, just ask!
Don't you get bored of winning?

Fields.DialogueText: I've certainly honed your confidence!
Why do you think I decided to train you?
*THUD*
Phew! I'm exhausted. How are you, Giorgio?
I can't feel my fingertips. Apart from that, I'm doing all right.
Sorry if I hurt you earlier. The body slam was unintentional.
Non si scusi, Capitano. I'm so proud of how far you've come. I would be honored to fight alongside you on the Libyan front.

Fields.MenuText: You're still planning on defending Libya, then?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, but... with such a talented warrior by my side, perhaps I won't be martyred after all.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think I'm ready for such a battle?

Fields.DialogueText: I would never lie to you about something so serious, Capitano. I believe you have enough skill to be a powerful ally.

Fields.MenuText: I could never have done it without you.

Fields.DialogueText: That makes me so happy, Capitano.
Then our next stop is Libya.
That's right, Capitano. For my decisive battle.
To be honest, Giorgio... there's another reason as to why I've been so adamant about training...
Capitano?! Why are you holding my hand so suddenly?!
Whether it be Morganas aboard this ship, or invading forces in Libya...
Capitano, please, someone of your stature shouldn't conduct themselves so openly! It's unsightly!
Whether the gods themselves rise up from below the sea and seek to ravage your hull beyond repair...
Capitano... this is too much... I feel like my head is going to melt...
I will protect you with my life. I promise to never leave your side.
You already explained that you desired to fight by my side, Capitano. You don't need to repeat--
No.
Capitano...
Giorgio. If you look at me like that...
I will never leave your side. In this life and the next, I want to be with you for eternity.
I'd like... I'd love that. Now, as per my teacher's instruction, how about we have some fun now that training is over? A certain board game is calling out to me from my quarters. Care to join me?
Sì, Capitano! I'd love to!
How long have they been going at it?
Two hours from when I started watching with no end in sight! They're so evenly matched!
I've got five on San Giorgio if you want to match it.
You're on! Let's come back later and you can pay me then!
Ha! You wish!
You're still *pant* not giving in *pant*, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I can do this all day.

Fields.DialogueText: Likewise!

Fields.MenuText: If you need a rest, we can take a break.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't underestimate me, Capitano!

Fields.MenuText: I could use a break.

Fields.DialogueText: Come now, that's not the Capitano I know and... let's just continue!
I've been training so much! There's no way I can lose this time!
You say that, Capitano! But your leg is still wide open! When will you learn!?
Is that what you think?
Whu? You jumped!
It's over!
Capitano, no! If you land on me from such height I'll be flattened like a pancake!
*GLOMPF*
I... I won? I won!
Con...gratu...lations, Capitano. Now... could you please roll over? You're crushing my lungs!
Right, sorry!
*ALARM*
No rest for the wicked, huh, Giorgio? Let's deal with these Morganas and take some well deserved rest.
@BATTLE
